parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The power train failure can cause the motorcycle to stall or lose power, increasing the risk of a crash.
symptoms: or has difficulty shifting gears; the check engine warning indicator illuminates; unknown red triangle icon illuminates; the vehicle spontaneously accelerates; the RPMS fail to increase or decrease from 2

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The transmission failure can cause the motorcycle to lose power or stall, increasing the risk of a crash.
symptoms: The motorcycle loses power or stalls; the transmission fails to engage properly; the gears do not properly engage when switched.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An inaccurate speedometer can cause the rider to misjudge their speed, increasing the risk of a crash.
symptoms: The speedometer reading is off by 4 miles per hour.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The high-speed instability of the motorcycle can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially lead to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The motorcycle wobbles or shakes violently at speeds above 60 mph
especially when passing other vehicles or driving in turbulent air; the handlebars move erratically; the motorcycle pulls to one side; the rider feels unsafe and may lose control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The installation of a speed regulator, which limits the motorcycle's speed to 101 mph, may be a attempt to hide the instability defect, and can lead to a loss of trust in the manufacturer.
symptoms: The motorcycle's speed is limited to 101 mph; the speed regulator was not disclosed at the time of purchase.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The manufacturer's lack of response or inadequate response to the complaints can lead to frustration and a sense of abandonment among customers.
symptoms: The manufacturer does not respond to complaints or fails to provide a satisfactory solution; the manufacturer claims that the issue is inherent to the bike or that it is working as designed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The unstable handling and vibration issues can cause loss of control, accidents, or near-miss situations, potentially leading to injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The motorcycle becomes unstable while driving at high speeds

especially when driving behind a semi-truck or in windy conditions; the front end of the vehicle shakes without warning; abnormal vibration from the motorcycle; the rear of the motorcycle shimmies and sways abnormally back and forth.
